intro: Lepidium virginicum var. pavonianum, commonly known as the pavonian peppergrass, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many economically important crops. The plant typically grows in open, disturbed habitats such as fields and roadsides. It produces small, yellow flowers in clusters and has a mat-forming growth habit. Its leaves are alternate, pinnately lobed, and often have a slightly hairy texture.
